com.isoterik.mgdx

Class MinGdxGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.MinGdxGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

    public abstract class MinGdxGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
    Your starter class must extend this class to make it a minGDX game. MinGdxGame initializes all the core systems and start your game.

    If you need to override any of the life cycle methods in your starter classes, don't forget to call the implementation of the super class.

      • create

        public void create()
        Specified by:
        create in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

      • initGame

        protected abstract Scene initGame()
        Implement this method to tell minGdx the initial scene of your game. This is where you'll typically initialize your splash scene and return it. You can optionally set splashTransition to the transition you want to animate the scene with.
        Returns:
        the initial scene of your game

      • setLogLevel

        public void setLogLevel(int logLevel)
        Sets the log level that libGDX uses for logging.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - the log level. Should be one of LOG_DEBUG, LOG_ERROR, LOG_INFO, LOG_NONE
